Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: JoannaF4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just spent a few days at Hotel Marvi in Barcelona. For a two-star hotel, the service was excellent, the staff were very friendly and helpful, and the rooms were quite spacious and very clean. We were both very satisfied with this hotel and would recommend it to anyone staying in Barcelona. The breakfast was a bit simple perhaps but I would recommend to the management to add some cereals. This little addition , I think, would widen the choice and definitely improve the breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely simple but perfect for our stay”
Reviews.Author: dave2566
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for two nights after returning from a cruise out of Barcelona. This hotel is extremely simple. No frills, nothing fancy, actually reminded me of a college dorm room. However, with that being said, it was exactly what we wanted. Since we only were planning on sleeping and recharging in the room we didn't really want (or need) Waldorf-Astoria quality amenities. The room was clean, the staff courteous and nice, free quick breakfast, free wifi, good location to the metro (a 10 foot walk across the street) and close to attractions. There are several fast food and deli type establishments with a block and the surrounding area seemed to be somewhat safe (we weren't out extremely late so it's hard to say for sure). Overall, if you are in Barcelona to see the sights and want an easy and simple room for sleeping and rest, I would recommend staying here. I understand that some people who are accustomed to hotel rooms in the U.S. might find Marvi to be a little too simple, but if you go in not expecting anything ritzy you will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Marvi - cheap but do not expect extra's”
Reviews.Author: JMZB5F1
Reviews.Content: We went in Barcelona in november 2011. We took the plane friday afternoon spent 2 nights in "Barca" and then took the plane back on sunday evening. Well , as it was our first stay in "Barca" i choose this litle hotel with no pretentions. The positive : 1 - cheap 2 - rooms are ok 3 - breakfast is not plantourus , but just enough to start the day. 4 - Very central position close to subway entrance and about 500 meters ( yards ) from Plaça Catalunya and Las Ramblas. The negative 1 - too noisy the night 2 - the hotel seems clean , ,but, looking carefully you will realize it is NOT. 3 - walls are paper thin , you can hear people speaking and clearly understand . 4 - staff unfriendly - disdainfull - providing untrustfull information, not providing the information on the most convenient ( cheapest ) ways to reach some point or another in the city. I appositely played the "sucker" to get information from them and they have tried (3 times) to send us to the most expensive ones ( funny isn't it ?). Hotel Marvi, you will neever see us again, and when i say something , i mean it.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal”
Reviews.Author: WantHome
Reviews.Content: As was said, great location close to tourist locations and right on top of a metro station. Good, friendly stuff who is happy to recommend and suggest honestly. Rooms are basics, not so much comfortable beds, but I have seen worse. Too basic breakfast. Overall, good deal for the relatedly inexpensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, price”
Reviews.Author: Brian S
Reviews.Content: Super happy with our stay at Marvi. The rooms are basic but clean. Nice bathrooms. They let us check in when we showed up at 10 in the morning. All 3 of the desk people we worked with were helpful, friendly and proficient in English. I was very impressed with their professionalism and knowledge. The location is only 2 small blocks from Placa de Catalunya, one if the hubs of the city and the north end of La Ramblas. Recommend highly!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for the price”
Reviews.Author: raymondjames8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within walking distance to all the tourist destinations and the Metro - Universitat, was at your doorstep. The aerobus drops you off right at Plaza Universitat! The rooms were basic & clean & there was free wi-fi. The Continental breakfast was the same every day and a little variety would be good. We stayed for 5 nights, so it became uninteresting. The first room that was assigned to us was an interior room with windows facing an interior well. I requested a room with a view since we would be there for 5 nights. We ended up with a front room with two high French doors. Even though it was noisier, it was worth the change. For long stays, such as ours, a hotel with some amenities and larger rooms would nice to come back to after a full day of touring....but you would have to pay for that difference. An overall good experience & the staff were helpful. Would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for city tour”
Reviews.Author: milelena
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Marvi with my husband for 3 nights, Friday to Monday, to explore the city of Barcelona and attend a match at the Camp Nou. The hotel location was very good as it was near the hop on hop off buses, the train station, the shops etc. Everything was in a short walking distance. The staff was very helpfull and friendly, they could tell us what to avoid and what is worth to see in the city. We had a croissant and some toast with jam, coffee and orange juice as breakfast, which was satisfactory for us. The room was clean and comfortable. The hotel was secure as there were cameras at the entrance and we had to ring the bell to open the door. No stranger was allowed to enter. The only thing we did not like about the hotel was the very bad sound insulation. Our room was near the street and it was like the window was always open. The noice from the road and the traffic did not let us sleep well none of the nights statying there. However, we recommend this hotel for few days to explore the city of Barcelona. But, do not forget to ask for a room NOT in the street!

Reviews.Title: “Good affordable hotel in very central location”
Reviews.Author: JTH7
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed in this hotel for four nights in April, at a cost of 99 euro per night for the room. We chose this hotel because of the good reviews and the very central location, just one block away from Placa de Catalunya, the biggest square in the city centre. There is also a Metro station across the street. The room we got was a twin even though we had booked a double (the lady at reception told us that this was the only room left). We pushed the two twins together though and it worked out okay. The room was small but clean and, perhaps as we were on one of the higher floors, I didn't hear any noise. One of the ladies who works at reception was very friendly and helpful, with good English, and put my girlfriend and I on the guestlist for a nightclub one night and even provided me with a paracetamol tablet on another night when I had a headache! The other staff members who we came across were fine too. The hotel is up one flight of stairs and there was someone on the main desk 24 hours a day so it felt pretty safe. The room rate included a continental breakfast which we only actually ate on one occasion. It was pretty much as one would expected - mainly toasts, a few biscuits and juices, that sort of thing. So in summary I would say that while Hotel Marvi is not luxurious, for the price and location it is certainly to be recommended. If I return to Barcelona, I will probably stay here again. P.S. The nightlife in Barcelona is great - check out the Gothic Quarter one night and the Port Olympic another. The latter is more upscale and expensive but also very good fun!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful reception staff”
Reviews.Author: Shan_Abellaneda
Reviews.Content: During our 5-city 8-day tour of Spain, this was the only hotel that verbally acknowledged receipt of our email requesting for a street facing room - and they gave us just that! Very helpful reception staff who also gave us maps and a brief orientation of the city. Again, the only hotel who bothered to do so. Lastly, also the only hotel that gave us free breakfast - simple breakfast but sufficient to fill ur tummy :) Barcelona as a city, is another story altogether, beware of pickpockets and using the metro at night. for my full review of this hotel and Barcelona, please read my blog :-) http://the-f-word-blog.blogspot.com/2011/07/valencia-back-to-barcelona-and-glimpse.html

Reviews.Title: “Great People , clean , convenient Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dogs_fly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our first trip to Barcelona. The hotel is basic , clean, with AC and wifi access but no lobby computer in case you need that. However we did find an internet place within one block which cost 1Euro for 45 min - to check email , print boarding passes etc.. The Hotel is right across the plaza from the Aerobus Universitat stop from the airport so it's convenient to get to . It is about 2-3 blocks off the top of the Ramblas which is good - close but not too close. Breakfast Croissant , drip coffee, and OJ included. Most important, is that the people were all very nice and helpful including recommendations for places to eat and help with airport and transportation issues.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value in Barcelona”
Reviews.Author: doitonabike
Reviews.Content: We were exceptionally pleased with Hotel Marvi. The reviews here were generally positive but the location, reviews and price seemed a mis-match. Why isn't it more expensive if it's so good. The Hotel met or exceeded our expectations and was exactly as described on this and other sites. Some have complained about the air-conditioning; it worked very well once the desk clerk demonstrated the correct settings. The WIFI system has been upgraded with a server for every floor so we had a very fast and reliable connection for researching our visit to Barcelona and telephoning home. TV service was good. The room size was more than adequate, it was very quiet and the bathroom was new and modern, nice towels, etc. Some guests might consider the bed too firm but we liked it; only the pillows could have been a bit thicker. There are many other comments respecting the excellent location. To that we can add proximity to gay restaurants and bars and a welcoming environment for a gay couple. The only possible negative might be that the breakfast was a bit spartan, but it was adequate for the price-point. We promised the manager and good review and happily recommend the Hotel Marvi for vacations to Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “very good for a couple of days”
Reviews.Author: Clarky040
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty good place. Not too expensive for the location. Its located a few hundred metres from the end of La Rambla. Rooms were clean and comfortable although they didn't replace the toilet paper on the second day which was a bit of a hassle. Otherwise the staff were very helpful and friendly. Breakfast is very simple but at least its provided. Would stay for a couple of days again but could maybe shop around if staying for longer.

Reviews.Title: “very clean and friendly, value for money hotel”
Reviews.Author: vauxracer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on a weekend break with my partner his mum, I had emailed the hotel asking for high floor street facing rooms n got exactly that (4th and 5th floors). Arrived 11pm and were buzzed straight in front door is locked when ciggarette kiosk on ground floor is shut this made the place feel very safe, very quick and friendly check in. Rooms were very clean ans had twin beds, bathroom with hairdryer, nice fluffly towels and a small selection of toiletries (shampoo, bath/shower gel soap, comb etc). Yes there is a little noise from the traffic etc but when the window is shut its nothing really. The breakfast was simply juice, tea/coffee,crossant,and toast,jam etc enough to keep u going. The transport buses/metro etc are brilliant n regular to different parts of city to see the sights, plenty of shops,restaurants,bars near this hotel. I would definatly reccommend this hotel as a good base for exploring barca as well as been clean friendly and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Convient, Affordable & Pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: retro27
Reviews.Content: This is a no frills hotel in the heart of the tourist district. It's a 5 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya and La Rambla. The hotel was clean although the walls in my room did have a few dings in them. I am giving this hotel 5 stars because of the service. The staff at the hotel were always eager to help and were very friendly. I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to anyone on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, well-located, budget option”
Reviews.Author: citybythelake
Reviews.Content: A great value for the location. The hotel is across the street from the Metro, and just a few short blocks from Plaza Catalunya and the Passeig de Gracia. While the room was sparsely decorated, it was clean and quiet, and we had a full bath, a queen bed, and an inner courtyard view. The staff was friendly and willing to help in every way, from giving directions to booking tours (which we didn't do, but they were willing)! After canceling a side trip, they were accommodating and let us stay an extra night. The hotel is on a pretty busy street, any time of day or night, so we felt pretty safe. You have to be buzzed in after a certain hour, and security is tight. There's a Tabac shop on the ground level, making the front entrance a bit busy at times. The front desk is on the level above. There is an elevator and free Wi-Fi in the dining area. It's not a luxury accommodation, but the location, price and service can't be beat. Besides, you're in Barcelona, so there's no need to spend that much time in the room anyways!

Reviews.Title: “Budget-friendly hotel, cozy atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Arthur010
Reviews.Content: Hotel Marvi is a very good hotel located just in front of Plaça Universitat (Metro Universitat) a few steps from Plaça de Catalunya. The façade seems to be a little outdated and need some fresh paint but once you enter everything is brand new and super clean. At ground floor there is a tobacco joint that is busy all day over. After a few steps one reachs the lobby area. Staff is friendly enough and gives tips to avois scams and pickpocketing in Barcelona. I stayed at room 402 which gave us a pleasant street view and not so noisy. Air conditioning worked efficiently and not noisy at all. Bathroom and shower gave me a very good impression. Breakfast was ok (crunchy croissants, toasts, orange juice, water, chocolate, tea, butter, jams and muffins). I would like to share some tips around this area: Tapas restaurant : Aribau , Carrer d'Aribau, 3 just a block from hotel Tapas bar: Celler de Tapas, Plaça de la Universitat, 5 , less than a block Ice cream parlor Amorino, ask for vanilla de Bourbon and chocolate Las Rambleas 125 www.amorino.es The best jamon (ham) sandwich rated by NYT , Viena, www.viena.es Viena Rambles, Rambles, 115 Mercat Santa Caterina Restaurant, Carrer d'En Giralt El Pellisser, 2, organic and fresh products The only drawback there is no available PC if you need check emails head to El Corte Ingles (at 7th floor computer section) and there is no mini fridge. So if you need cold refreshments by at any other bar/restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean. Good value, excellent all round really.”
Reviews.Author: HanzelnGretel
Reviews.Content: Convenient and clean. Good value,excellent all round and very helpful and cheerful staff. Our room was actually far superior to one we had once not a stones throw away on the same side of the street. That was more like a prison cell with a view to match! The street view room we had at the Marvi was great. The noise some people have complained about is unwarranted...not a problem......a bit, and I mean a bit, of city noise is all part of the atmosphere, and expected.

Reviews.Title: “I would suggest the Hotel Marvi to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: suenshirl
Reviews.Content: This is an especially clean and economical place to stay in Barcelona. Perfect location and very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place”
Reviews.Author: parkr
Reviews.Content: Great location. Decent rooms. I'd recommend it. The rooms are basic and clean. Good for a person(s) who just want a decent place to stay that is close to the heart of Barcelona.

Reviews.Title: “NICE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Poli74
Reviews.Content: I will not call an hotel....maybe a hostel will be the right word. The location is the best , near Plaza Cataluña and the Ramblas, next to the hotel you have the metro, for a girl who is traveling alone, is a very good location. The rooms are basics but most important clean with private and nice bathroom, mine does not have a window...so was a little claustrophobic but most of the time I was travelling so... At night you can hear voices, noises from water tubs..etc lets say is not the quiet hotel. About the breakfast I cannot call that breakfast....only coffee + a toast, no cheese...no nothing was very disapointed.

Reviews.Title: “A Little Gem of a Hotel......”
Reviews.Author: Miranda678
Reviews.Content: in a great location. This was my first trip to Barcelona so I was a little anxious, especially having read a few dubious reviews on here! But it was recommended to me and I would not hesitate to recommend it to anyone. Our room was at the back of the Hotel (but away from lift) and I was glad of this particularly as Barcelona were celebrating winning La Liga and the festivities lasted well into the night, but it was nice to go to sleep to the sound of fireworks...... Concierges were helpful but not effusive, the rooms were changed every day and were spotless. `As others have said, the breakfast was spartan and I think they could lash out and add a piece of cheese or something, but the coffee was strong (the way I like it) so that was fine. Finally, I think that this Hotel does exactly what it promises. Good price, fantastic location, and a general air of good Karma floating around it. Can't wait to go back. .

Reviews.Title: “Central, Clean, Cheap”
Reviews.Author: Housie
Reviews.Content: This was in ideal location. 4/5 minute walk from Las Ramblas therefore not as noisy and hectic as those located on main street. Rooms basic but clean. Bathroom good with warm shower, clean towels every day and decent hair dryer. Safe in room which was 30 Euro, returned at end of your trip. We used the hotel as a base and it was ideal for this purpose. Breakfast adequate to start your day, croissant, toast, tea/coffee and orange juice. First time I have visited city and i would definetly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore any bad reviews - this is a gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGirlN17
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at Hotel Marvi for 2 nights in Oct 08 with another couple. Fantastic location within 5 mins walk of Las Ramblas. Flew in with Ryan Air to Girona & found the bus transfer to Barcelona very easy. It took an hour which was ok but if we could have flown into Barcelona it would have been better. Watch out in the coach station in Barcelona as we were targetted by 2 women pickpockets in the lift. It was only that I had my hand over the zip of my handbag that prevented them - as they were jostling us to get into the lift when really there was no room with all our cases . They realised that I'd sussed them & held the lift door to get away. So just be on your guard. Back to the hotel - clean, nothing fancy but perfect for a budget 2 night break. Our room was at the front but on a higher floor so the traffic below was a background rumble - no hassle. Have to say that the reception staff were the best I've met in a long time. Great English & one guy spent ages giving us directions to a restaurant with drawing of maps. Told us to stay away from the main street tourist places as we'd get ripped off ! The restaurant was about 5 mins walk off a sideturning off Las Ramblas - it was frequented by Spanish only & the food was fantastic & cost 50 euro for a main course for 4 with a bottle of wine & 2 beers. Would never have found it without help. Definitely recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a cold and noisy night-this is just it!”
Reviews.Author: CPH22
Reviews.Content: After a cruise we had a one night stay in Barcelona, so our travel agency booked this hotel for us. It was seriously a nightmare. We didnt sleep at all, it was freezing cold and we got a really smelly room. We had to sleep with jackets!!!!! The bathroom had a really strong sewer smell, that went to the whole room. The room beside us was full of girls screaming all night long. Also there were a blinking light right ouside our window. I cant say it enough, it was terrible! The breakfeast is a joke, crispbread packed in plastic, come on you call this breakfast? One thing you also have to know is that, there is a tobaco shop right under the hotel, so when you want to get into the hotel you have to squeeze between the tobaco customers. The only benefits of this hotel is the location, but is it really worth it?

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HungryBear
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Marvi mid-December 2008, and found it to be a real gem. It is perfect for tourists who are out all day, and need a comfy place to sleep at night. It may not be for you if you are looking for a full service luxury hotel. There is a tobacco shop on the ground floor. The reception area, a small sitting area, and the breakfast room are on the first floor, and the guest rooms are above. When the tobacco shop is open, you can go right up to your room. When it is closed, you buzz, and the receptionist sees you in the video camera and opens the door. I appreciated this level of security. As other reviewers have mentioned, it is well located to access bus and subway, and right across from Universitat de Barcelona. It is a 10-20 minute walk to Las Ramblas, and a little further to Barri Gothic. Our room faced the street, and was a little noisy until we noticed that the sliding doors to the balcony had been reversed. When we slid the left door to the right, and the right door to the left, the noise was much better, and we could lock the doors! The person at the desk was always friendly, and tolerated our broken Spanish. They were happy to speak English with us when our Spanish was not sufficient. The rooms were clean, and not too small. The bathroom was suitable. We had no trouble with the elevator. We had a great time in Barcelona!

Reviews.Title: “A Decent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Margiemarg
Reviews.Content: The best part about Hotel Marvi is its location. It's 5 min from Placa Catalunya (the last stop of the Airport Shuttle that runs every 6 min) and the Ramblas. The hotel lobby is actually on the first floor, after going past a ground floor hallway with tobacco shop and up some stairs. In the evenings, when the tobacco shop is closed, you have to be buzzed in. We previously requested that we did not want a room with a window that faces an elevator chute, and they accommodated us and give us a room that faced the street. The room was relatively clean. Our main problem was that towards the end of our stay, cigarette smoke wafted in from the adjacent room, possibly through part of the ceiling, which appeared to be strips of aluminum paneling. We were also a little disappointed that they did not have any English channels on TV. Overall, it was a decent stay mainly because we were so close to many of the major sights, and we did appreciate the free breakfast and wi-fi in the lobby. The staff were also very polite. It's a good place for tourists who are out most of the day/evening and just want a place to sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Honeyjj
Reviews.Content: Great location, 5 minute walk to la Rambla and to the main square where all the tourist buses start. Felt very safe there. Friendly reception staff. Clean room. We got breakfast included which was just a croissant & bread plus drinks but did us fine to get us started for the day. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: a&ssussex
Reviews.Content: this is a great little two star budget hotel in a central location. The room was clean and bright and had a nice balcony with decent views and the staff were friendly and helpful. There are plenty of bars and some nice tapas restaurants around the area (try cellar tapas which was really good) but you can easily walk to the Ramblas if you want more life or you have a metro station directly opposite. the breakfast was adequate (croissant and dutch toasts with jam etc) - all in all a great little hotel

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Petisita
Reviews.Content: It's location was perfect, near the MACBA, near the gothic barri, las Ramblas and several other tourist attractions. At the corner, towards the ramblas, there is a tipical Barcelona bar where we had a nice breakfast every morning. The hotel people were nice, accomodating and corteus. The rooms are simple but they have all you need:clean sheets, a well sized bathroom, a small tv and it gets clean at convenient hours.

Reviews.Title: “hotel marvi, barcelona”
Reviews.Author: feliciapatrascu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Marvi last week for 4 nights. Good things: very good location, 5 minutes away from Pl.Catalunya and La Rambla. Very easy to find the hotel coming from the airport with Aerobus, get out at the Pl.Universitat, 3 min.away. We received a quiet room with view on the back side of the hotel, this was very good. Bad things: insufficient breakfast but for the good location and such an inexpensive accomodation, you can easy forget about it. Conclusion: we'll stay again at Hotel Marvi next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: iaso
Reviews.Content: The people behind the desk were really cool, friendly, smiling and helpful. I left my credit card there by accident, they posted it to me two days later... really helpful. A+

Reviews.Title: “A good base”
Reviews.Author: Sunny247
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Marvi at the end of June for a week. Our room was on the 5th floor and was at the front of the building - which meant we had a window. I'm not 100% sure on this but the hotel staff seemed to indicate that other rooms may not have had an outward facing window but had windows facing a wall. From our room however, we had a view across the streets in front of the building. The room was spotless and was a fairly good size. The bathroom was also good - a nice big bath to soak in after a long day walking around. It also had a good shower over the bath and again, this was spotless. The room was cleaned every day and the towels were also changed daily. The air conditioning was included in the price and worked! I would probably echo the comments of some other reviews about the staff - they gave us all the information we needed and were polite but I wouldn't go as far to say that they were friendly! The hotel makes an excellent base - it is right next to a stop on the metro (Universitat) and the nearest stop for the bus tour is less than 5 mins walk. It is about 5-10 mins walk from the top of Las Ramblas (the nice end!). If we had any criticisms, they would be that the breakfast wasn't great - a croissant, cup of coffee and some orange juice. Also the beds were two single beds rather than a double. The final thing would be the noise. The hotel is central to Barcelona which is fantastic for sightseeing but the flip side is that its busy! We were woken on the first night by the traffic outside stopping and starting at the traffic lights - however we did get used to it and we didn't really notice it after the second night. Overall, Hotel Marvi is a really clean hotel that is central to the city. It is excellent value for money and we would recommend it but just be prepared to hear the traffic if you're at the front.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite hotel in Spain”
Reviews.Author: Jean_Valjean
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Marvi for 3 nights, May 18 to 21. Location with regards to the tourist sites and transportation was pretty good. The working girls or so they appeared to be, just outside the door left something to be desired in a hotel, as did the graffiti all over the building. Also having a hotel with a magnetic locking front door and a call button to let you in did not leave you with a comfortable feeling for the neighborhood. That is not just at night but all day also. As for the rooms they were clean enough but reminded me a lot a something you would get in the US at a big city YMCA. Or at least what was available 25 years ago at Y's in many major cities. The beds were comfortable, thats a plus but the window looked out on to the elevator shaft. At least I had a window my traveling companions did not. The maids had a habit of blocking the elevator so it would not leave the floor they were on so you walked the stairs most of the time. The desk clerk had to go unblock the elevator several times in the 3 days we were there to make the elevator available for people who could not climb the stairs. The hotel is not bad but at best it is below average accommodations but considering the price it gets 3 stars out of 5. This is a very basic hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you don't mind hard beds, it's not so bad.”
Reviews.Author: doktor.s
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: * Great location - right across from the Universitat subway stop, two blocks from Plaza Cataluña and the beginning of the shopping mile Ramblas Cataluña. * There are plenty of small shops and restaurants nearby. * Friendly staff. Although I spoke in Spanish with the staff, I noticed many tourists speaking in English as they asked for recommendations of where to shop or eat. The staff at Reception was always friendly. * Water pressure is quite strong (which I liked). * There was never a lack of hot water, which was also nice especially when you returned from waking all day long and wanted to soak your feet in hot (not warm) water. Ah.. relief. * They have an in-room safe deposit box big enough to fit a small laptop (with 12in screen - not your 15 to 17in screen laptops.) * A/C unit works quite well and was not too loud. * Hotel has video cameras on every floor, so although the room doors do not seem very safe, nothing bad happened during our entire 4 night stay there. THE NOT SO GOOD: * The hotel advertises internet - they do not offer it. * The hotel beds are hard. Although some people might actually prefer that. We had problems sleeping the first night so on the second night we asked if all beds were just as hard. We were told that they were. My solution was to take a winter blanket they have in the room and placed it on top of the mattress which helped soften the 'blow.' * The hotel room is 'cleaned' every day, but attention to detail is not a main concern. The lights switches and main light structures remained dirty until I cleaned them myself. * We choose a room facing the street because we were told they are the ones that offer a nicer view and have more natural light. We were on the fifth floor and you do have a nice view. If you can sleep without problems I would recommend it. I can sleep through a storm and outside traffic noise did not bother me. My better half is more of a light sleeper and could hear everything. * While it was harder for me to hear the outside noise, it was fairly easy to hear the people next door and what went on the corridors on different floors. * Hotel room has a small color TV but it only shows programs in Catalan and Spanish. Nothing in other languages. * The Hotel offers a breakfast. Coffee tastes terrible and their orange juice gave me stomach ache. So, unless you have a strong stomach or a taste for bad coffee, I would recommend skipping it and choosing to start your day eating somewhere else. THE FINAL WORD: AT 94 Euro a night I can hardly call this 2 Star hotel a bargain. Specially when for 50 Euro more per night I can stay at the Five Star Hotel Jazz just across the street, enjoy the pool on their Terrace and have a very comfy bed to sleep in.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Marvi
HotelInfo.Address: Calle Pelayo 6, 08001 Barcelona, Spain
